events.originalText: Burmese military and police forces killed at least 82 civilians in the Bago massacre, including 2021 Myanmar coup d'état protesters.
events.subtitle: Tatmadaw
events.headline: Bago massacre: Burmese military and police kill 82 civilians, including protesters

events.originalText: Charles, Prince of Wales, married Camilla Parker Bowles in a civil ceremony at the Windsor Guildhall.
events.subtitle: Charles III
events.headline: Prince Charles marries Camilla Parker Bowles in civil ceremony at Windsor Guildhall

events.originalText: President of Niger Ibrahim Baré Maïnassara was shot dead by soldiers in Niamey.
events.subtitle: Ibrahim Baré Maïnassara
events.headline: President of Niger Ibrahim Baré Maïnassara shot dead by soldiers in Niamey

events.originalText: Iranian filmmaker Morteza Avini was killed by a land mine in Fakkeh while producing a documentary.
events.subtitle: Morteza Avini
events.headline: Iranian filmmaker Morteza Avini killed by land mine in Fakkeh

events.originalText: Iraqi philosopher Muhammad Baqir al-Sadr (pictured) and his sister Amina were executed by the regime of Saddam Hussein.
events.subtitle: Muhammad Baqir al-Sadr
events.headline: Iraqi philosopher Muhammad Baqir al-Sadr and sister executed by Saddam Hussein regime

events.originalText: The first EMD F40PH, Amtrak's most widespread diesel locomotive for many years, entered into service.
events.subtitle: EMD F40PH
events.headline: First EMD F40PH enters service for Amtrak

events.originalText: NASA announced the selection of the Mercury Seven, the first astronauts in Project Mercury.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA selects Mercury Seven as first astronauts in Project Mercury

events.originalText: Palestine war: Fighters from the Zionist paramilitary groups Irgun and Lehi attacked the village of Deir Yassin near Jerusalem, killing more than 100 Palestinian Arabs.
events.subtitle: 1948 Palestine war
events.headline: Palestine war: Irgun and Lehi fighters attack Deir Yassin village, killing over 100 Palestinian Arabs

events.originalText: Sixteen white and black men began a two-week journey in the American South, acting in defiance of local laws that enforced segregated seating on public buses.
events.subtitle: Journey of Reconciliation
events.headline: American South: 16 men defy segregated seating laws on public buses

events.originalText: The Glazier–Higgins–Woodward tornadoes killed 181 people and injured 970 others in Texas, Oklahoma, and Kansas.
events.subtitle: 1947 Glazier–Higgins–Woodward tornadoes
events.headline: Glazier–Higgins–Woodward tornadoes kill 181 people in Texas, Oklahoma, and Kansas

events.originalText: The German heavy cruiser Admiral Scheer, the most successful capital-ship surface raider of the Second World War, was sunk by British bombers.
events.subtitle: Heavy cruiser
events.headline: German heavy cruiser Admiral Scheer sunk by British bombers in WWII

events.originalText: World War II: During the German invasion of Norway, Vidkun Quisling attempted to seize power in the first coup to be broadcast over radio.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Vidkun Quisling attempts coup during German invasion of Norway

events.originalText: After being denied permission to perform at Constitution Hall by the Daughters of the American Revolution, African-American singer Marian Anderson gave an open-air concert (pictured) on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C.
events.subtitle: DAR Constitution Hall
events.headline: Marian Anderson gives open-air concert at Lincoln Memorial after being denied at Constitution Hall

events.originalText: First World War: The Canadian Corps began the first wave of attacks at the Battle of Vimy Ridge in Vimy, France.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: First World War: Canadian Corps launches attacks at Battle of Vimy Ridge

events.originalText: Despite being vastly outnumbered, forces of the Old Swiss Confederacy defeated an Austrian army at the Battle of Näfels.
events.subtitle: Old Swiss Confederacy
events.headline: Old Swiss Confederacy forces defeat Austrian army at Battle of Näfels

events.originalText: During the Year of the Five Emperors Septimius Severus was proclaimed Roman emperor by his troops at Carnuntum in modern-day Austria.
events.subtitle: Year of the Five Emperors
events.headline: Septimius Severus proclaimed Roman emperor by troops at Carnuntum
